explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly discusses the use of machine learning methods for generating synthetic data and modeling equity returns.
explanations.unsupervised learning: The methods used (conditional importance weighted autoencoders and conditional normalizing flows) are unsupervised learning techniques as they learn the underlying data distribution without labeled data.
explanations.deep learning: The paper employs deep learning techniques such as autoencoders and normalizing flows for modeling high-dimensional financial data.
explanations.representation learning: The generative models used in the paper inherently perform representation learning by capturing the underlying structure of the equity returns data.
explanations.autoencoder: The paper specifically mentions using conditional importance weighted autoencoders, a variant of variational autoencoders, for modeling returns.
explanations.variational autoencoders: The conditional importance weighted autoencoders are a variant of variational autoencoders, which are discussed in the paper.
explanations.normalizing flows: The paper mentions using conditional normalizing flows for the task of modeling equity returns.
explanations.generative model: The entire work focuses on building a generative model for 500-dimensional joint distribution of S&P 500 returns.
